title: Leek, pear and potato hash
blurb: This simple supper is perfect for an autumnal midweek meal. Love serving this with a spoonful of brown sauce, and a side of baked beans. Comfort food at its best!

ingredients.preparation: scrubbed clean and diced into 1cm (/2in) cubes
leaves finely chopped, plus 4 leaves reserved for garnish

method: Heat half the oil in a large frying pan and cook the potatoes over a medium-high heat for 10 minutes, stirring frequently until they start to become golden.
Add the leek and mushrooms, then cook for a further 5 minutes, stirring frequently to avoid sticking. Stir in the pears and sage and cook for a further 2-3 minutes.
Heat the remaining oil in a small frying pan then add the reserved sage leaves and fry for 1-2 minutes until crisp. Leave to drain on some kitchen paper (they will crisp up more as they cool).
Season the hash to taste with salt and pepper, then serve hot topped with the fried sage leaves.
other: EASY TIP: Switch up the flavour by swapping the sage for rosemary or thyme.
